*Club domestic league appearances and goals, correct as of 12:38, 16 March 2025 (UTC)</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p><b>Lukas Josef Podolski</b> (<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1177148991">.mw-parser-output .IPA-label-small{font-size:85%}.mw-parser-output .references .IPA-label-small,.mw-parser-output .infobox .IPA-label-small,.mw-parser-output .navbox .IPA-label-small{font-size:100%}</style><span class="IPA-label IPA-label-small">German:</span> <span class="IPA nowrap" lang="de-Latn-fonipa"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:IPA/Standard_German" title="Help:IPA/Standard German">[ˈluːkas<span class="wrap"> </span>poˈdɔlskiː]</a></span>; born <b>Łukasz Józef Podolski</b>, <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1177148991"><span class="IPA-label IPA-label-small">Polish:</span> <span class="IPA nowrap" lang="pl-Latn-fonipa"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:IPA/Polish" title="Help:IPA/Polish">[ˈwukaʂ<span class="wrap"> </span>pɔˈdɔlskʲi]</a></span>, 4 June 1985) is a professional <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a> or <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attacking_midfielder" class="mw-redirect" title="Attacking midfielder">attacking midfielder</a> for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ekstraklasa" title="Ekstraklasa">Ekstraklasa</a> club <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G%C3%B3rnik_Zabrze" title="Górnik Zabrze">Górnik Zabrze</a>. He is known for his powerful and accurate left foot, explosive shooting, technique and probing attacks from the left side.<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-6"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>6<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Podolski joined <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1._FC_K%C3%B6ln" title="1. FC Köln">1. FC Köln</a> in 1995 where he made it into the first team in 2003 resulting in 81 appearances for the club before moving to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_Bayern_Munich" title="FC Bayern Munich">Bayern Munich</a>. With Bayern, Podolski won the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bundesliga" title="Bundesliga">Bundesliga</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DFB-Pokal" title="DFB-Pokal">DFB-Pokal</a> double in 2008. Podolski returned to 1. FC Köln in 2009. He later signed for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Premier_League" title="Premier League">Premier League</a> club <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arsenal_F.C." title="Arsenal F.C.">Arsenal</a> in 2012, with whom he won the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FA_Cup" title="FA Cup">FA Cup</a> in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_FA_Cup" title="2013–14 FA Cup">2014</a>. He then moved on loan to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serie_A" title="Serie A">Serie A</a> club <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inter_Milan" title="Inter Milan">Inter Milan</a> in January 2015, before signing six months later for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Galatasaray_S.K._(football)" title="Galatasaray S.K. (football)">Galatasaray</a> where he also won the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_Cup" title="Turkish Cup">Turkish Cup</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015%E2%80%9316_Turkish_Cup" title="2015–16 Turkish Cup">2016</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Eurosport_7-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-Eurosport-7"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>7<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Born in Poland, Podolski was eligible to play for both <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland</a> and Germany (due to his <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silesians" title="Silesians">Silesian</a> paternal grandparents having been born in then-<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imperial_Germany" class="mw-redirect" title="Imperial Germany">Imperial Germany</a>), and he was open to playing for the Polish team but was rejected by the then Polish coach <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pawe%C5%82_Janas" title="Paweł Janas">Paweł Janas</a> in 2003,<sup id="cite_ref-Goal.com_8-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-Goal.com-8"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>8<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> having already appeared for Germany at youth level. After making his first appearance for the senior team in 2004, Podolski enjoyed great success with the Germany national team.<sup id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-9"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>9<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He was part of the squad in seven major tournaments, winning the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 FIFA World Cup</a>. He is the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_national_football_team#Most_capped_players" title="Germany national football team">fourth most-capped</a> player in German history, with 130 caps, and the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_national_football_team#Top_goalscorers" title="Germany national football team">third-highest goalscorer</a> in German history, having scored 49 times.<sup id="cite_ref-Eurosport_7-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-Eurosport-7"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>7<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Eurosport2_10-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-Eurosport2-10"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>10<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>On 29 May 2013, Podolski scored the fastest goal in Germany national team history at that time, after just nine seconds of the 4–2 friendly win over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecuador_national_football_team" title="Ecuador national football team">Ecuador</a>. It was at that time the second fastest international goal in history, second only to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Marino_national_football_team" title="San Marino national football team">San Marino</a>'s <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Davide_Gualtieri" title="Davide Gualtieri">Davide Gualtieri</a>'s 8.3-second strike against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/England_national_football_team" title="England national football team">England</a> in 1993.<sup id="cite_ref-11" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-11"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>11<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-12" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-12"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>12<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Podolski retired from international football on 22 March 2017 after scoring the winner as captain in a friendly against England.<sup id="cite_ref-Eurosport2_10-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-Eurosport2-10"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>10<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<meta property="mw:PageProp/toc">
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Club_career">Club career</h2><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Club career"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="1._FC_Köln"><span id="1._FC_K.C3.B6ln"></span>1. FC Köln</h3><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: 1. FC Köln"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-left" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lukas_Podolski.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lukas Podolski - Wikipedia_files/250px-Lukas_Podolski.JPG" decoding="async" width="190" height="383" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Lukas_Podolski.JPG/330px-Lukas_Podolski.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Lukas_Podolski.JPG/500px-Lukas_Podolski.JPG 2x" data-file-width="704" data-file-height="1418"></a><figcaption>Podolski playing for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1._FC_K%C3%B6ln" title="1. FC Köln">Köln</a> in 2006</figcaption></figure>
<p>Podolski began playing football at the age of six in the youth team of FC 07 Bergheim, where he played until he joined <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1._FC_K%C3%B6ln" title="1. FC Köln">1. FC Köln</a> at the age of ten. It was there that Podolski's talents were first noticed. In 2003, at the age of 18, Podolski was still part of the club's youth side. At this time the club found itself in dire straits battling to avoid relegation from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bundesliga" title="Bundesliga">Bundesliga</a>. First team boss <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marcel_Koller" title="Marcel Koller">Marcel Koller</a>, working on a shoestring budget, invited Podolski to train with the senior players and he made his top flight debut shortly afterwards on 22 November 2003. Even though Köln failed to avoid a drop to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2._Bundesliga" title="2. Bundesliga">2nd division</a>, Podolski had shown what he could do, scoring 10 goals in his first 19 senior appearances.<sup id="cite_ref-13" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-13"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>13<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> This was the best tally by an 18-year-old in the history of the Bundesliga until <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Florian_Wirtz" title="Florian Wirtz">Florian Wirtz</a> overtook the record in 2021.<sup id="cite_ref-14" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-14"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>14<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Though his call up to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_national_football_team" title="Germany national football team">German</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2004" title="UEFA Euro 2004">Euro 2004</a> squad brought along interest from several top clubs, Podolski stayed at Köln to help the club gain promotion in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2004%E2%80%9305_2._Bundesliga" title="2004–05 2. Bundesliga">2004–05 season</a>. With 24 goals, Podolski advanced to become the league's best scorer. Somewhat unusually, Podolski remained part of the Germany squad, even though he did not play in the national top-tier league.
</p><p>After Köln were promoted, the pressure was on Podolski to keep the club in the Bundesliga practically singlehandedly. Podolski managed to score 12 goals in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2005%E2%80%9306_Bundesliga" title="2005–06 Bundesliga">2005–06 season</a>, but eventually, Köln were relegated again. It became clear that Podolski would not stay again to push them through the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2006%E2%80%9307_2._Bundesliga" title="2006–07 2. Bundesliga">2006–07 season</a>—even more so, as Podolski was becoming an integral part of the national team.
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="FC_Bayern_Munich">FC Bayern Munich</h3><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: FC Bayern Munich"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<p>In 2006, clubs such as <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liverpool_F.C." title="Liverpool F.C.">Liverpool</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_Bayern_Munich" title="FC Bayern Munich">Bayern Munich</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hamburger_SV" title="Hamburger SV">Hamburger SV</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SV_Werder_Bremen" title="SV Werder Bremen">Werder Bremen</a>, and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Real_Madrid_C.F." class="mw-redirect" title="Real Madrid C.F.">Real Madrid</a> manifested their interest in Podolski, even though he had a contract with <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1._FC_K%C3%B6ln" title="1. FC Köln">1. FC Köln</a> through 2007. On 1 June 2006, Podolski announced that a transfer agreement had been reached with Bayern Munich, allowing him to join the Bavarian side for the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2006%E2%80%9307_FC_Bayern_Munich_season" title="2006–07 FC Bayern Munich season">2006–07 season</a>. Financial details of the deal were not immediately available, but the transfer fee was speculated to be around €10&nbsp;million. He made his Bundesliga debut for Bayern on 11 August 2006, coming on as a substitute in the 88th minute of a 2–0 victory against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Borussia_Dortmund" title="Borussia Dortmund">Borussia Dortmund</a>. On 9 September 2006, he came on as a second-half substitute in a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2006%E2%80%9307_DFB-Pokal" title="2006–07 DFB-Pokal">DFB-Pokal</a> game versus <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_St._Pauli" title="FC St. Pauli">FC St. Pauli</a>. Only 26 seconds after the second half started, he scored the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Equaliser_(football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Equaliser (football)">equaliser</a>, levelling the match at 1–1. On 14 October 2006, with his first Bundesliga goal for Bayern, Podolski helped to secure the club's 4–2 win over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hertha_BSC" title="Hertha BSC">Hertha BSC</a>. On 26 October 2006, Podolski suffered a serious injury to his right ankle joint caused by teammate, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mark_van_Bommel" title="Mark van Bommel">Mark van Bommel</a>, during a training session. Consequently, Podolski missed more than five match weeks. He returned from this injury and scored against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alemannia_Aachen" title="Alemannia Aachen">Alemannia Aachen</a>.
</p><p>After Bayern bought in Italian striker <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luca_Toni" title="Luca Toni">Luca Toni</a> in 2007, Podolski received less playing time due to coach <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ottmar_Hitzfeld" title="Ottmar Hitzfeld">Ottmar Hitzfeld</a>'s preference to partner <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miroslav_Klose" title="Miroslav Klose">Miroslav Klose</a> and Toni together instead. However, Bayern ended the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2007%E2%80%9308_FC_Bayern_Munich_season" title="2007–08 FC Bayern Munich season">2007–08 season</a> by winning a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2007%E2%80%9308_Bundesliga" title="2007–08 Bundesliga">league</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2007%E2%80%9308_DFB-Pokal" title="2007–08 DFB-Pokal">cup</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Double_(association_football)" title="Double (association football)">double</a>, giving Podolski the first major silverware of his career.
</p><p>Despite former national team coach <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J%C3%BCrgen_Klinsmann" title="Jürgen Klinsmann">Jürgen Klinsmann</a> taking charge of Bayern for the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2008%E2%80%9309_FC_Bayern_Munich_season" title="2008–09 FC Bayern Munich season">2008–09 season</a>, Podolski again failed to break into the team's regular first choice line-up. After a rather unhappy spell at Bayern, he returned to former club <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1._FC_K%C3%B6ln" title="1. FC Köln">Köln</a> on 1 July 2009.<sup id="cite_ref-15" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-15"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>15<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Return_to_1._FC_Köln"><span id="Return_to_1._FC_K.C3.B6ln"></span>Return to 1. FC Köln</h3><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: Return to 1. FC Köln"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<p>After Podolski was assured by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_national_football_team" title="Germany national football team">national team</a> coach <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joachim_L%C3%B6w" title="Joachim Löw">Joachim Löw</a> that a return to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1._FC_K%C3%B6ln" title="1. FC Köln">FC Köln</a> would not harm his chances of international football, an agreement to sign him was agreed between <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_Bayern_Munich" title="FC Bayern Munich">Bayern Munich</a> and Köln in January 2009, although he would not return to Köln until the start of the summer transfer window. On 1 July, Podolski returned to Köln on a four-year contract, at a reported fee of around €10&nbsp;million, equivalent to the fee Bayern paid to sign him in 2006.<sup id="cite_ref-16" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-16"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>16<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-17" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-17"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>17<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Köln created a website where people were able to buy pixels of an image of Podolski for €25 per 8x8 pixel square, in order to gather €1 million to reduce the cost of the transfer;<sup id="cite_ref-18" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-18"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>18<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-19" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-19"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>19<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Formula One driver and Köln supporter <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Schumacher" title="Michael Schumacher">Michael Schumacher</a> bought several pixels for €875.<sup id="cite_ref-20" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-20"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>20<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Having just moved from Bayern Munich, Podolski had a poor first season at Köln, scoring just three times the entire season. One of his goals however, came from a free kick against his former club to salvage a draw.
</p><p>In the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010%E2%80%9311_Bundesliga" title="2010–11 Bundesliga">2010–11</a> season, Podolski scored his 50th Bundesliga goal in the match against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hannover_96" title="Hannover 96">Hannover 96</a> in March 2011. Throughout the entire season, Podolski scored 13 goals and made seven assists.
</p><p>The <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2011%E2%80%9312_Bundesliga" title="2011–12 Bundesliga">2011–12</a> season was the final season in his second spell for Köln. Despite the team's relegation to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2._Bundesliga" title="2. Bundesliga">2. Bundesliga</a>, Podolski scored 18 goals in 29 league <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bundesliga" title="Bundesliga">Bundesliga</a> appearances.
</p><p>Out of respect for his loyalty and achievements for the club, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1._FC_K%C3%B6ln" title="1. FC Köln">1. FC Köln</a> chose to retire his famous No. 10 shirt as long as he is an active football player.<sup id="cite_ref-21" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-21"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>21<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> However, Köln began assigning the number 10 shirt again at the start of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_Bundesliga" title="2014–15 Bundesliga">2014–15 Bundesliga</a> season.<sup id="cite_ref-22" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-22"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>22<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Arsenal">Arsenal</h3><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" title="Edit section: Arsenal"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading4"><h4 id="2012–13_season"><span id="2012.E2.80.9313_season"></span>2012–13 season</h4><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" title="Edit section: 2012–13 season"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-right" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lukas_Podolski,_2012-08-18.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lukas Podolski - Wikipedia_files/Lukas_Podolski,_2012-08-18.jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="364" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/83/Lukas_Podolski%2C_2012-08-18.jpg/330px-Lukas_Podolski%2C_2012-08-18.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/83/Lukas_Podolski%2C_2012-08-18.jpg/500px-Lukas_Podolski%2C_2012-08-18.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1800" data-file-height="3450"></a><figcaption>Podolski playing for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arsenal_F.C." title="Arsenal F.C.">Arsenal</a> in 2012</figcaption></figure>
<p>Podolski was linked with <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Premier_League" title="Premier League">Premier League</a> club <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arsenal_F.C." title="Arsenal F.C.">Arsenal</a> throughout the 2012 winter transfer window but no deal materialised. However, on 30 April 2012, it was officially announced that Podolski had signed for Arsenal on a long-term deal, for an undisclosed fee.<sup id="cite_ref-23" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-23"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>23<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 12 August 2012, Podolski started for Arsenal in a pre-season match against his former club, Köln, scoring twice, once from a penalty in a 4–0 victory.<sup id="cite_ref-David_C._Cutler_24-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-David_C._Cutler-24"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>24<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Podolski took the number 9 from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Park_Chu-Young" class="mw-redirect" title="Park Chu-Young">Park Chu-Young</a>, who had been loaned out to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Celta_de_Vigo" class="mw-redirect" title="Celta de Vigo">Celta Vigo</a>, after the number 10 shirt vacated by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robin_van_Persie" title="Robin van Persie">Robin van Persie</a> was given to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Wilshere" title="Jack Wilshere">Jack Wilshere</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-25" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-25"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>25<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-26" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-26"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>26<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Podolski then started in his first official match for Arsenal against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunderland_A.F.C." title="Sunderland A.F.C.">Sunderland</a> on the opening day of the Premier League on 18 August 2012. He played 63 minutes before being subbed off for another 2012 summer signing, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olivier_Giroud" title="Olivier Giroud">Olivier Giroud</a>, in the match which finished 0–0.<sup id="cite_ref-27" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-27"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>27<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He scored his first goal for Arsenal on 2 September in a 2–0 win against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liverpool_F.C." title="Liverpool F.C.">Liverpool</a> at <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anfield" title="Anfield">Anfield</a> whilst also providing the assist for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santi_Cazorla" title="Santi Cazorla">Santi Cazorla</a> to score his first for the Gunners.<sup id="cite_ref-28" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Podolski scored his second goal for Arsenal in the following game, scoring a free-kick from 25 yards in a 6–1 victory against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Southampton_F.C." title="Southampton F.C.">Southampton</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-29" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-29"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>29<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>On 18 September 2012, he scored his first <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a> goal for the Gunners in a 2–1 away win against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Montpellier_HSC" title="Montpellier HSC">Montpellier</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-30" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-30"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>30<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In Arsenal's second game in the Champions League, Podolski scored again as Arsenal defeated Greek champions <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olympiacos_F.C." title="Olympiacos F.C.">Olympiacos</a> 3–1 on 3 October.<sup id="cite_ref-31" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-31"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>31<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Podolski then scored his first goal in more than a month against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fulham_F.C." title="Fulham F.C.">Fulham</a> in a thrilling 3–3 draw.<sup id="cite_ref-32" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-32"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>32<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 17 November, Podolski scored his fourth League goal as Arsenal defeated <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tottenham_Hotspur_F.C." title="Tottenham Hotspur F.C.">Tottenham</a> 5–2 in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_London_derby" title="North London derby">North London derby</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-33" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-33"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>33<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He then helped Arsenal qualify for the last 16 of the Champions League by scoring the second goal as Arsenal beat Montpellier 2–0.<sup id="cite_ref-34" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-34"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>34<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Podolski then played a pivotal part in an impressive 5–2 win away from home against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reading_F.C." title="Reading F.C.">Reading</a> at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madejski_Stadium" title="Madejski Stadium">Madejski Stadium</a>, scoring the first goal and assisting 2 more, which had helped teammate <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santi_Cazorla" title="Santi Cazorla">Santi Cazorla</a> to score his first ever hat-trick. On 30 December 2012, Podolski played an integral part of the team that beat Newcastle 7–3. His first contribution was an incisive pass to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theo_Walcott" title="Theo Walcott">Theo Walcott</a> for Arsenal's first goal. In addition, due to Newcastle's failure to clear the ball off their line, Podolski pounced on a header for his last goal of 2012. He was substituted for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aaron_Ramsey" title="Aaron Ramsey">Aaron Ramsey</a> to a standing ovation.<sup id="cite_ref-35" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-35"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>35<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 23 January 2013, Podolski produced an impressive performance as Arsenal beat West Ham 5–1, scoring one goal and setting up three others. On 2 February 2013, Podolski scored the only goal via a deflected free-kick to earn the Gunners a 1–0 victory over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stoke_City" class="mw-redirect" title="Stoke City">Stoke City</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-36" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-36"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>36<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 13 April, Podolski sealed a 3–1 win over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norwich_City_F.C." title="Norwich City F.C.">Norwich City</a> by scoring his first goal since February.<sup id="cite_ref-37" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-37"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> After Giroud's three-game ban appeal was rejected,<sup id="cite_ref-38" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-38"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>38<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Podolski began playing as a centre forward, starting with the 1–1 draw against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-39" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-39"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>39<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-40" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-40"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>40<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Podolski then scored twice in a 4–1 victory over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wigan_Athletic_F.C." title="Wigan Athletic F.C.">Wigan Athletic</a>, resulting in Wigan's relegation from the Premier League.<sup id="cite_ref-41" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-41"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>41<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Podolski ended his first season in Arsenal with a total of 16 goals and 11 assists.
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading4"><h4 id="2013–14_season"><span id="2013.E2.80.9314_season"></span>2013–14 season</h4><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7" title="Edit section: 2013–14 season"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-right" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Podolski_(11691855233).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lukas Podolski - Wikipedia_files/Podolski_(11691855233).jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="285" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/74/Podolski_%2811691855233%29.jpg/330px-Podolski_%2811691855233%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/74/Podolski_%2811691855233%29.jpg/500px-Podolski_%2811691855233%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="667" data-file-height="1000"></a><figcaption>Podolski warming up for Arsenal in 2014</figcaption></figure>
<p>On 24 August 2013, Podolski netted his first goals of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_Arsenal_F.C._season" title="2013–14 Arsenal F.C. season">2013–14 season</a>, scoring twice for Arsenal away at <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fulham_F.C." title="Fulham F.C.">Fulham</a> in a 3–1 win.<sup id="cite_ref-42" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-42"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>42<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> However, he was injured in his next match in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2013–14 UEFA Champions League">Champions League</a> qualifier against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fenerbah%C3%A7e_S.K._(football)" title="Fenerbahçe S.K. (football)">Fenerbahçe</a> and was ruled out for 10 weeks.<sup id="cite_ref-43" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-43"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>43<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
Podolski returned for Arsenal against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Ham_United_F.C." title="West Ham United F.C.">West Ham United</a> in a 3–1 win on Boxing Day, scoring the team's third goal in the 79th minute.<sup id="cite_ref-44" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-44"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>44<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Podolski netted his first two goals in 2014 with a brace in a 4–0 FA Cup fourth round win over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coventry_City" class="mw-redirect" title="Coventry City">Coventry City</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-45" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-45"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>45<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He later scored in a 2–1 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_FA_Cup" title="2013–14 FA Cup">FA Cup</a> win over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liverpool_F.C." title="Liverpool F.C.">Liverpool</a> in February to send Arsenal through to the quarter-finals of the competition.<sup id="cite_ref-46" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-46"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>46<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Podolski scored two goals in March as he began to feature more regularly in the Gunners starting line-up. His first was a goal against his former club, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_Bayern_Munich" title="FC Bayern Munich">FC Bayern Munich</a>, in the return leg of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a> last 16 tie. Podolski's goal proved nothing more than a consolation, as Arsenal crashed out of Europe, losing 3–1 on aggregate to the defending champions.
</p><p>His second goal in March was an equaliser against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swansea_City" class="mw-redirect" title="Swansea City">Swansea City</a> in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Premier_League" title="Premier League">Premier League</a> clash. A minute after scoring, Podolski provided an assist for teammate Olivier Giroud, who gave Arsenal a 2–1 lead. However, a last minute own goal by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mathieu_Flamini" title="Mathieu Flamini">Mathieu Flamini</a> meant the game finished 2–2 and effectively ended Arsenal's hopes of lifting the Premier League title for another season.
</p><p>Arsenal qualified for the FA Cup final on 12 April following a win against Wigan, in which Podolski was substituted after 68 minutes. He scored twice in Arsenal's next game, a 3–1 win against West Ham United at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emirates_Stadium" title="Emirates Stadium">Emirates Stadium</a> and followed that display up with another brace in Arsenal's next game, a 3–0 win away to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hull_City_A.F.C." title="Hull City A.F.C.">Hull City</a>. He started in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FA_Cup_Final" class="mw-redirect" title="2014 FA Cup Final">2014 FA Cup Final</a> against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hull_City" class="mw-redirect" title="Hull City">Hull City</a> and left the pitch for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yaya_Sanogo" title="Yaya Sanogo">Yaya Sanogo</a> after 61 minutes as Hull led Arsenal 1–2. Arsenal went on to win the game 3–2 after extra time, thereby ending the club's nine-year trophy drought.<sup id="cite_ref-47" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-47"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>47<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading4"><h4 id="2014–15_season"><span id="2014.E2.80.9315_season"></span>2014–15 season</h4><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" title="Edit section: 2014–15 season"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<p>After winning the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">World Cup</a> for Germany, Podolski and compatriots <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Per_Mertesacker" title="Per Mertesacker">Per Mertesacker</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mesut_%C3%96zil" title="Mesut Özil">Mesut Özil</a> were excused by Arsenal from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FA_Community_Shield" title="2014 FA Community Shield">2014 Community Shield</a>, which they won 3–0 against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manchester_City_F.C." title="Manchester City F.C.">Manchester City</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-48" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-48"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>48<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In November, Podolski spoke about his unrest with his current role with Arsenal and his lack of game time, saying: "Of course I am not happy with my situation right now. I can't be satisfied with that. It is hard when you can't do what you love."<sup id="cite_ref-49" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-49"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>49<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading4"><h4 id="Inter_Milan_(loan)"><span id="Inter_Milan_.28loan.29"></span>Inter Milan (loan)</h4><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9" title="Edit section: Inter Milan (loan)"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<p>On 5 January 2015, Arsenal announced that Podolski had completed a move to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serie_A" title="Serie A">Serie A</a> club <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inter_Milan" title="Inter Milan">Inter Milan</a> on loan for the remainder of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_Serie_A" title="2014–15 Serie A">2014–15 season</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-50" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-50"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>50<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He joined the side for training after the deal was finalised ahead of their league match away to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juventus_FC" title="Juventus FC">Juventus</a> on 6 January.<sup id="cite_ref-51" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-51"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>51<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In the 1–1 draw at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juventus_Stadium" title="Juventus Stadium">Juventus Stadium</a>, he came on as a substitute for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zdravko_Kuzmanovi%C4%87" title="Zdravko Kuzmanović">Zdravko Kuzmanović</a> after 54 minutes.<sup id="cite_ref-52" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-52"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>52<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Podolski was not named in Inter's squad list for the knockout stages of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Europa_League" title="UEFA Europa League">UEFA Europa League</a> with coach Roberto Mancini preferring <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xherdan_Shaqiri" title="Xherdan Shaqiri">Xherdan Shaqiri</a> over the German international.<sup id="cite_ref-53" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-53"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>53<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 28 April 2015, Podolski scored his only goal with Inter to win the match 2–1 in the 65th minute against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Udinese_Calcio" title="Udinese Calcio">Udinese</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-54" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-54"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>54<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Galatasaray">Galatasaray</h3><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10" title="Edit section: Galatasaray"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<p>Podolski signed a three-year contract with Turkish club <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Galatasaray_S.K._(football_team)" class="mw-redirect" title="Galatasaray S.K. (football team)">Galatasaray</a> on 4 July 2015 for an initial fee of £1.8 million, after which the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S%C3%BCper_Lig" title="Süper Lig">Süper Lig</a> champions will pay Arsenal £2.1 million for three consecutive seasons thereafter.<sup id="cite_ref-55" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-55"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>55<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-56" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-56"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>56<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He instantly won the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_Super_Cup" title="Turkish Super Cup">Turkish Super Cup</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-57" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-57"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>57<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In the final of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_Cup" title="Turkish Cup">Turkish Cup</a> on 26 May 2016, he scored the decisive goal for Galatasaray in the 1–0 win over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fenerbah%C3%A7e_S.K._(football)" title="Fenerbahçe S.K. (football)">Fenerbahçe</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-58" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-58"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>58<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Vissel_Kobe">Vissel Kobe</h3><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11" title="Edit section: Vissel Kobe"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-right" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lukas_Podolski_(37322776096)_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lukas Podolski - Wikipedia_files/Lukas_Podolski_(37322776096)_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="254" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/93/Lukas_Podolski_%2837322776096%29_%28cropped%29.jpg/330px-Lukas_Podolski_%2837322776096%29_%28cropped%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/93/Lukas_Podolski_%2837322776096%29_%28cropped%29.jpg/500px-Lukas_Podolski_%2837322776096%29_%28cropped%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1693" data-file-height="2259"></a><figcaption>Podolski playing for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vissel_Kobe" title="Vissel Kobe">Vissel Kobe</a> in 2017</figcaption></figure>
<p>On 2 March 2017, Podolski announced his transfer to Japanese club <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vissel_Kobe" title="Vissel Kobe">Vissel Kobe</a> after the completion of the Turkish season.<sup id="cite_ref-59" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-59"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>59<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 29 July 2017, he played his first match for Vissel Kobe and scored two goals in a 3–1 win over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omiya_Ardija" class="mw-redirect" title="Omiya Ardija">Omiya Ardija</a> in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J1_League" title="J1 League">J1 League</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-60" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-60"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>60<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 11 August 2018, he assisted <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andr%C3%A9s_Iniesta" title="Andrés Iniesta">Andrés Iniesta</a>'s first goal in the J1 League in a 2–1 win over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jubilo_Iwata" class="mw-redirect" title="Jubilo Iwata">Jubilo Iwata</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-61" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-61"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>61<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>On 8 December 2019, he scored a hat-trick in a 4–1 win over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J%C3%BAbilo_Iwata" title="Júbilo Iwata">Júbilo Iwata</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Daily_62-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-Daily-62"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>62<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> It was his first hat-trick in the J1 League.<sup id="cite_ref-Daily_62-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-Daily-62"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>62<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>On 1 January 2020, Podolski won his first trophy in Japan, starting in Vissel Kobe's 2–0 victory over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kashima_Antlers" title="Kashima Antlers">Kashima Antlers</a> in the final of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Emperor%27s_Cup" title="2019 Emperor&#39;s Cup">2019 Emperor's Cup</a>;<sup id="cite_ref-63" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-63"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>63<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> it was also the club's first ever major trophy.<sup id="cite_ref-EmperorsCup_64-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-EmperorsCup-64"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>64<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Antalyaspor">Antalyaspor</h3><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12" title="Edit section: Antalyaspor"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<p>On 23 January 2020, Podolski joined <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antalyaspor" title="Antalyaspor">Antalyaspor</a> on a one-and-a-half-year contract.<sup id="cite_ref-65" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-65"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>65<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Górnik_Zabrze"><span id="G.C3.B3rnik_Zabrze"></span>Górnik Zabrze</h3><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13" title="Edit section: Górnik Zabrze"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<p>On 6 July 2021, Podolski was announced by the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ekstraklasa" title="Ekstraklasa">Ekstraklasa</a> club <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G%C3%B3rnik_Zabrze" title="Górnik Zabrze">Górnik Zabrze</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-66" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-66"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>66<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> having signed a one-year contract that comes with the option of another year,<sup id="cite_ref-67" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-67"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>67<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and with the club being probably his last club before retiring, after stating it's his dream to finish his footballing career playing for Górnik.<sup id="cite_ref-68" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-68"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>68<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He made his debut on 30 July, coming on as a substitute in a 3–1 league home defeat against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lech_Pozna%C5%84" title="Lech Poznań">Lech Poznań</a> at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arena_Zabrze" title="Arena Zabrze">Arena Zabrze</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-69" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-69"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>69<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 21 November 2021, he scored his first goal for Górnik Zabrze, in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ekstraklasa" title="Ekstraklasa">Ekstraklasa</a> home fixture against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legia_Warsaw" title="Legia Warsaw">Legia Warsaw</a> 3–2.<sup id="cite_ref-70" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-70"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>70<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>On 19 May 2022, Podolski agreed to a one-year contract extension.<sup id="cite_ref-71" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-71"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>71<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 5 November 2022, he scored a goal from inside his own half in a 4–1 away win against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pogo%C5%84_Szczecin" title="Pogoń Szczecin">Pogoń Szczecin</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-72" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-72"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>72<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 19 May 2023, he extended his Górnik contract until 2025.<sup id="cite_ref-73" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-73"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>73<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="International_career">International career</h2><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14" title="Edit section: International career"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="International_debut_and_breakthrough">International debut and breakthrough</h3><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=15" title="Edit section: International debut and breakthrough"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<p>In late 2003, after several impressive performances in his first few <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bundesliga" title="Bundesliga">Bundesliga</a> games, Polish media suggested then-Poland national team coach <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pawe%C5%82_Janas" title="Paweł Janas">Paweł Janas</a> should check Podolski out, as he was still eligible to play for Poland. Janas ignored the request stating in one of the press interviews that "as for today we have much better strikers in Poland and I don't see a reason to call up a player just because he played one or two good matches in the Bundesliga. He's not even a regular starter at his club." By that time Podolski was still interested in representing <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland</a>, but as the season progressed German media increasingly highlighted his performances to suggest he should be called up to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_national_football_team" title="Germany national football team">Germany national team</a>. When his full potential was finally unveiled, he had already decided to represent Germany. At the end of the season Köln were relegated, but Podolski impressed so much, that he held his debut for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rudi_V%C3%B6ller" title="Rudi Völler">Rudi Völler</a>'s Germany on 6 June 2004, at age 19, in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kaiserslautern" title="Kaiserslautern">Kaiserslautern</a> against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hungary_national_football_team" title="Hungary national football team">Hungary</a> with a late substitute appearance. He had become the first second-division player since 1975 to break into the national team.
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Euro_2004">Euro 2004</h3><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=16" title="Edit section: Euro 2004"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<p>Podolski played for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_national_football_team" title="Germany national football team">Germany</a> at <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2004" title="UEFA Euro 2004">Euro 2004</a>, where he was the squad's youngest player. He made one substitute appearance in the game against the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Czech_national_football_team" class="mw-redirect" title="Czech national football team">Czech Republic</a>, when he came on for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Torsten_Frings" title="Torsten Frings">Torsten Frings</a> at half-time.
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="2006_World_Cup">2006 World Cup</h3><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=17" title="Edit section: 2006 World Cup"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-right" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lukas_Podolski_Germany_2006.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lukas Podolski - Wikipedia_files/250px-Lukas_Podolski_Germany_2006.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="201" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/64/Lukas_Podolski_Germany_2006.jpg/500px-Lukas_Podolski_Germany_2006.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="621" data-file-height="500"></a><figcaption>Podolski playing for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_national_football_team" title="Germany national football team">Germany</a> in 2006</figcaption></figure>
<p>Podolski was selected in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_2006_squads" class="mw-redirect" title="Germany 2006 squads">Germany squad</a> for the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2006_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2006 FIFA World Cup">2006 World Cup</a>, where he partnered <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miroslav_Klose" title="Miroslav Klose">Miroslav Klose</a> as the attack duo in the starting lineup. He scored his first World Cup goal in Germany's third group match against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecuador_national_football_team" title="Ecuador national football team">Ecuador</a>, and both goals in the 2–0 win over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sweden_men%27s_national_football_team" title="Sweden men&#39;s national football team">Sweden</a> in the round of 16. He became the first player since 1962 to score two goals in the first 12 minutes of a World Cup match and only the third player ever to accomplish the feat.<sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">[<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (April 2012)">citation needed</span></a></i>]</sup> Germany finished third in the tournament, and while his teammate Miroslav Klose won the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Cup_Golden_Boot#Golden_Boot" class="mw-redirect" title="World Cup Golden Boot">Golden Boot competition</a>, Podolski's three goals tied him for second place with <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ronaldo_(Brazilian_footballer)" title="Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)">Ronaldo</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thierry_Henry" title="Thierry Henry">Thierry Henry</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fernando_Torres" title="Fernando Torres">Fernando Torres</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Villa" title="David Villa">David Villa</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maxi_Rodr%C3%ADguez" title="Maxi Rodríguez">Maxi Rodríguez</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hern%C3%A1n_Crespo" title="Hernán Crespo">Hernán Crespo</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zinedine_Zidane" title="Zinedine Zidane">Zinedine Zidane</a>. Podolski was named the World Cup's <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_awards#FIFA_Young_Player_Award" title="FIFA World Cup awards">Best Young Player</a> ahead of players like <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo" title="Cristiano Ronaldo">Cristiano Ronaldo</a>.
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="UEFA_Euro_2008">UEFA Euro 2008</h3><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=18" title="Edit section: UEFA Euro 2008"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<p>In a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2008" title="UEFA Euro 2008">UEFA Euro 2008</a> qualifying game against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Marino_national_football_team" title="San Marino national football team">San Marino</a> in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serravalle,_San_Marino" title="Serravalle, San Marino">Serravalle</a> Podolski netted four goals in Germany's record 13–0 thrashing. He is one of only four German players to score four goals in an international match. He was the third after <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerd_M%C3%BCller" title="Gerd Müller">Gerd Müller</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Ballack" title="Michael Ballack">Michael Ballack</a>, and since this, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mario_G%C3%B3mez" title="Mario Gómez">Mario Gómez</a> has accomplished this feat. In Germany's 4–1 win against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slovakia_national_football_team" title="Slovakia national football team">Slovakia</a> in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bratislava" title="Bratislava">Bratislava</a> on 11 October 2006, he scored the first and the last German goal, both on assists by Miroslav Klose. He has continued to score goals at an astonishing rate. On 17 November 2007, in a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2008_qualifying_Group_D" title="UEFA Euro 2008 qualifying Group D">Euro qualifier</a> match against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyprus_national_football_team" title="Cyprus national football team">Cyprus</a>, Podolski was involved in every goal in Germany's 4–0 victory. This was one of Podolski's best performances for the national team. Even though he played out of his natural position, playing at left midfield, he netted one goal himself and was voted Man of the Match.
</p><p>On 8 June 2008, Podolski made his Euro 2008 entrance against debutants <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland</a> in a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2008_Group_B" title="UEFA Euro 2008 Group B">Group B</a> match in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Klagenfurt" class="mw-redirect" title="Klagenfurt">Klagenfurt</a>, Austria. He scored both goals in a 2–0 victory. He <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goal_celebration#Notable_non-celebrations" title="Goal celebration">avoided celebrating his goals</a>, however, to show respect for his country of birth. After the game he gave an emotional interview on Polish television. The goals put him in the lead in the Euro 2008 goal-scoring list for two days until <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Villa" title="David Villa">David Villa</a> scored a hat-trick for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain_national_football_team" title="Spain national football team">Spain</a> against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia_national_football_team" title="Russia national football team">Russia</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-74" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-74"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>74<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>On 12 June, Germany played <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Croatia_national_football_team" title="Croatia national football team">Croatia</a> in their second Group B match, again in Klagenfurt. Podolski scored the German team's only goal of the game in the 79th minute, by which time the Croatians were already leading 2–0. He did not celebrate this goal either despite it putting him joint first on the Euro 2008 goal-scoring list with <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Villa" title="David Villa">David Villa</a>. Podolski's goal was not enough to snatch a draw, with Croatia holding out for a 2–1 victory over Germany.<sup id="cite_ref-75" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-75"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>75<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 19 June, Germany played Portugal in the quarterfinal in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basel" title="Basel">Basel</a>, Podolski was instrumental in the first goal, whipping a cross into the penalty box that was slotted home by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastian_Schweinsteiger" title="Bastian Schweinsteiger">Bastian Schweinsteiger</a> in the 22nd minute to give Germany a 1–0 lead.
</p><p>On the international scene, Podolski seemed to be gravitating towards an attacking left midfield role from his traditional place as a striker. Initially, Löw had moved him to the wing in order to accommodate the partnership of Klose and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mario_G%C3%B3mez" title="Mario Gómez">Mario Gómez</a> up front. When this backfired, he resumed his forward position in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2008_Final" class="mw-redirect" title="UEFA Euro 2008 Final">UEFA Euro 2008 Final</a>, but was unable to prevent Germany losing 1–0 to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain_national_football_team" title="Spain national football team">Spain</a>. In a controversial incident, Podolski was headbutted by Spanish midfielder <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Silva" title="David Silva">David Silva</a>, although this went unnoticed by the referee and his assistants, and went unpenalised.<sup id="cite_ref-76" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-76"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>76<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Podolski was named in the 23-man squad as one of the players of the tournament along with countrymen <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Ballack" title="Michael Ballack">Michael Ballack</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philipp_Lahm" title="Philipp Lahm">Philipp Lahm</a>.
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="2010_World_Cup">2010 World Cup</h3><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=19" title="Edit section: 2010 World Cup"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:%C3%96zil_podolski.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lukas Podolski - Wikipedia_files/250px-Özil_podolski.JPG" decoding="async" width="190" height="216" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ea/%C3%96zil_podolski.JPG/330px-%C3%96zil_podolski.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ea/%C3%96zil_podolski.JPG/380px-%C3%96zil_podolski.JPG 2x" data-file-width="396" data-file-height="451"></a><figcaption>Podolski (right) celebrating with <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mesut_%C3%96zil" title="Mesut Özil">Mesut Özil</a> after Germany's win against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team" title="Argentina national football team">Argentina</a> at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2010 FIFA World Cup">2010 World Cup</a></figcaption></figure>
<p>On 6 September 2008, Podolski scored the opening two goals in Germany's first <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2010 FIFA World Cup">2010 World Cup</a> qualifier against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liechtenstein_national_football_team" title="Liechtenstein national football team">Liechtenstein</a> in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rheinpark_Stadion" title="Rheinpark Stadion">Vaduz</a>; a match that ended in a 6–0 victory for the Germans. He scored the opener in the 2–1 home win over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_national_football_team" class="mw-redirect" title="Russian national football team">Russia</a> on 11 October, when he turned <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vasili_Berezutski" title="Vasili Berezutski">Vasili Berezutski</a> on the edge of the penalty area, before unleashing a powerful shot past Russia's goalkeeper <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Igor_Akinfeev" title="Igor Akinfeev">Akinfeev</a>. He finished the qualification campaign second highest scorer of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_-_UEFA_Group_4" class="mw-redirect" title="2010 FIFA World Cup qualification - UEFA Group 4">Group 4</a> with six goals, behind teammate Miroslav Klose's 7. During one of the qualifying matches, he was involved in a bust-up with team captain Michael Ballack.
</p><p>On 13 June 2010, Podolski, who had become accustomed to his position as a winger scored the first goal in Germany's World Cup opening game in a 4–0 win against Australia, before assisting teammate <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_M%C3%BCller" title="Thomas Müller">Thomas Müller</a> for the third goal. On 18 June, Podolski missed a second-half penalty after a handling infraction committed by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nemanja_Vidi%C4%87" title="Nemanja Vidić">Nemanja Vidić</a> in the 1–0 loss to Serbia. The German team had gone down to 10-men after a second yellow was shown to Miroslav Klose in the 36th minute. Even though the Germans played with 10-men throughout the rest of the game, Podolski had numerous chances on goal. However, he was unable to capitalize, and the game ended in a surprise defeat for the Germans. However, he managed to score against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/England_national_football_team" title="England national football team">England</a> in the last 16, giving Germany a 2–0 advantage in the first half. They went on to beat England 4–1.<sup id="cite_ref-77" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-77"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>77<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In the quarter-final against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team" title="Argentina national football team">Argentina</a>, Podolski provided the assist for the first of Klose's two goals, bringing the score to 2–0. The Germans won the match 4–0.<sup id="cite_ref-78" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-78"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>78<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Euro_2012">Euro 2012</h3><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=20" title="Edit section: Euro 2012"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<p>During <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2012_qualifying" title="UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying">qualification</a>, Podolski provided assists for three goals and scored three times, helping Germany to win all ten matches of their qualification campaign. During <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2012" title="UEFA Euro 2012">Euro 2012</a>, Podolski started all three of Germany's Group B games, the third being his 100th appearance for Germany; a game in which he also scored. Podolski's last game at Euro 2012 was the successful <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy_national_football_team" title="Italy national football team">Italy national team</a> in the semi-finals against Germany, 2–1.
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="2014_World_Cup">2014 World Cup</h3><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=21" title="Edit section: 2014 World Cup"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Autogramm_vom_Weltmeister.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lukas Podolski - Wikipedia_files/Autogramm_vom_Weltmeister.jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="164" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/Autogramm_vom_Weltmeister.jpg/330px-Autogramm_vom_Weltmeister.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/Autogramm_vom_Weltmeister.jpg/500px-Autogramm_vom_Weltmeister.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2269" data-file-height="1954"></a><figcaption>Podolski after winning the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 World Cup</a></figcaption></figure>
<p>Podolski was part of Germany's <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 World Cup</a> campaign. Prior to the tournament, he played in five qualification matches. In the World Cup finals in Brazil, he appeared in the victories over USA and Portugal in the group stages, but did not play the full 90 minutes.<sup id="cite_ref-UEFA_profile_79-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-UEFA_profile-79"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>79<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Germany went on to become World Champions.
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Euro_2016_and_retirement">Euro 2016 and retirement</h3><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=22" title="Edit section: Euro 2016 and retirement"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<p>Podolski was included in the squad for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2016" title="UEFA Euro 2016">UEFA Euro 2016</a>. He made a substitute appearance against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slovakia_national_football_team" title="Slovakia national football team">Slovakia</a> during the tournament. After the tournament, on 15 August, he announced his retirement from international football (effective 23 March 2017) saying he wants to shift his focus and spend more time with his family.<sup id="cite_ref-80" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-80"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>80<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He was given his last ever international appearance for Germany against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/England_national_football_team" title="England national football team">England</a> on 22 March 2017 where he scored the winning goal.<sup id="cite_ref-81" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-81"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>81<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-82" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-82"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>82<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Style_of_play">Style of play</h2><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=23" title="Edit section: Style of play"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<p>Podolski possesses an explosive and accurate shot, reaching speeds of nearly 160&nbsp;km/h (99&nbsp;mph).<sup id="cite_ref-83" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-83"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>83<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Arsene Wenger described Podolski saying "He's certainly one of the best finishers I've ever seen...If there's one you want to see in front of the goal in a shooting position, it's him".<sup id="cite_ref-84" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_note-84"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>84<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In his early years, Podolski possessed explosive speed with great acceleration which was later affected by some lengthy injuries. He usually cuts inside either to shoot or pass the ball. Podolski is a physically strong player able to hold up the ball and produce key passes. Podolski has good dribbling and technical skills and is also a good crosser of the ball having set up many goals for his teammates from the left side. He is a penalty specialist, having missed only two penalties in his career.
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Career_statistics">Career statistics</h2><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=24" title="Edit section: Career statistics"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Club">Club</h3><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lukas_Podolski&amp;action=edit&amp;section=25" title="Edit section: Club"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>

<li id="cite_note-UCL-89"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_ref-UCL_89-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_ref-UCL_89-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_ref-UCL_89-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_ref-UCL_89-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_ref-UCL_89-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Appearances in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a></span>
</li>

</li>
<li id="cite_note-91"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lukas_Podolski#cite_ref-91" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Six appearances and two goals in UEFA Champions League, two appearances in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Europa_League" title="UEFA Europa League">UEFA Europa League</a></span>
</li>
